backend/main.mo: Empty backend actor with no logic or persistent data.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping features to affected frontend files and components.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Text file listing high-level summaries of many frontend components and styles.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point mounting the React app and loading main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Controls intro vs reveal screen state with animated transitions.
frontend/src/components/BengaliShayari.t: Displays four-line romantic Bengali shayari in a styled glassmorphic card.
frontend/src/components/FloatingHearts.t: Empty placeholder for floating hearts animation.
frontend/src/components/InteractiveTeddy: Empty placeholder for interactive teddy feature.
frontend/src/components/RevealTeddy.tsx: Fixed-position animated teddy bear image placed at bottom-right of screen.
frontend/src/components/RosePetals.tsx: Canvas animation spawning rose petals with an initial burst then gentle continuous fall.
frontend/src/components/ValentineIntroGa: Name-entry gate validating 'silpa' with teddy animations and error feedback.
Reveal screen combining rose petals, teddy animation, headline, and Bengali shayari.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Hook creating and managing backend actors with identity-aware initialization.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides a React context and provider for managing Internet Identity login state using Dfinity AuthClient, including loading stored identities, login flow, and status flags.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind base file defining global styles, custom OKLCH color variables including Valentine palette, font utilities, and custom animations.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstrap file that mounts the React app, wrapping it with React Query and the InternetIdentityProvider.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind configuration extending theme colors, animations, and containers, with support for Valentine color variables and plugins.
project_state.json: Metadata describing the project's current state, features, issues, and requirements for a two-screen Valentine web app.
